context: GoDaddy went public on April 1, 2015, with a successful IPO on the New York Stock Exchange, with shares soaring 30% on the first day of trading. The company raised nearly $460 million, pricing shares at $20 each, valuing the company at up to $5.48 billion including debt. At IPO, GoDaddy was the leading provider of web registration and hosting services with 59 million domains under management, representing approximately 20% of the world's Internet domains. The company served 12.7 million customers with revenue of $1.4 billion in 2014, up 22.7%. The market was expanding beyond traditional hosting into website builders and cloud services.

competitors.name: Namecheap
competitors.notes: Leading domain registrar competitor with cheaper renewal costs than GoDaddy. Offered free WHOIS domain privacy while GoDaddy charged extra. Strong value proposition for cost-conscious customers.

competitors.name: Network Solutions
competitors.notes: One of the first established ICANN-accredited domain registrars with long-standing industry presence. Offered all-in-one solution for domain services, web hosting, and website building.

competitors.name: Bluehost
competitors.notes: Top GoDaddy alternative for web hosting, offering superior features, value for money, and security. WordPress-recommended host with integrated website builder. All-in-one provider for hosting, domains, and site building.

competitors.name: HostGator
competitors.notes: Best for shared hosting with 99.99% uptime guarantee matching GoDaddy. Offered domain registration bundled with hosting plans. Strong competitor in shared hosting market.

competitors.name: SiteGround
competitors.notes: Premium shared hosting provider with excellent support and fast caching features. Known for superior uptime, site speed, and security compared to GoDaddy. Top-tier shared hosting option.

competitors.name: Domain.com
competitors.notes: Popular domain name registrar for easy registration and transfers. Direct competitor in domain registration market with competitive pricing.

competitors.name: Shopify
competitors.notes: Comprehensive ecommerce platform that started as website builder and expanded into domain registration. Provided complete business-building solution beyond traditional domain/hosting services.

competitors.name: Wix
competitors.notes: Website builder platform making it easier than ever to build websites. Competing in the website creation market with drag-and-drop tools.

competitors.name: Squarespace
competitors.notes: Website builder platform competing for customers wanting easy website creation. Offered integrated domain registration with website building services.

competitors.name: DreamHost
competitors.notes: Web hosting provider offering unlimited storage and bandwidth with free SSL certificates. Competed on features and transparent pricing.

competitors.name: IONOS
competitors.notes: Low-cost web hosting provider with excellent pricing and good feature selection. Offered similar services to GoDaddy at lower price points.
